revised_title: Catalysis by Supported Group VIII Metal Compounds: Hydrogenation and Isomerization of n-Butene over Silica-Supported Ruthenium Carbonyl Catalysts
tldr: The authors studied the reaction of n-butene with hydrogen over silica-supported ruthenium carbonyl catalysts. They found that the active catalyst is a ruthenium subcarbonyl containing five carbonyl ligands per ruthenium triad. The results showed that but-l-ene isomerization occurs in the absence of molecular hydrogen, and the mechanism involves a hydrogen abstraction-addition process and the formation of an allyl intermediate.
